content:
by Dominic Renzetti 
Sports Editor March  

The first day of spring saw the Eastern womens tennis team record its first home win of the season on Tuesday at Rex Darling Courts PERIOD The Panthers recorded a  win over a struggling Indiana University Purdue UniversityIndianapolis which has now lost eight straight matches PERIOD



Sophomore Janelle Prisner and junior Merritt Whitley earned an  win over Alisha Cummings and Danielle Haefele PERIOD Prisner and Whitley are now  as a pair PERIOD

Whitley said she and Prisner have good oncourt chemistry which has led to their success PERIOD

I think we have really good chemistry especially on the court she said PERIOD Were really good at motivating each other we know what makes each other play better and I think that contributes to a lot of our chemistry and what helps us win and stay competitive even when were losing or winning. whitley also said she and Prisner do a good job of keeping their composure on the court which also helps them perform PERIOD

It helps us keep our momentum and keeping our composure it helps us play better she said PERIOD Its definitely big part in helping us. the win was the third straight for Prisner and Whitley as a team PERIOD

Also earning a win for the Panthers in doubles play were seniors Amanda Dibbs and Annie Egan winning  over Vanessa Whyte and Abbey Neff PERIOD Also for the Panthers freshman Sephora Boulbahaiem and junior Kristen Laird fell to Shelby Hullett and Rachel Bridegroom by a score of  PERIOD

In singles Prisner and Whitley again found success winning their respective matches while Dibbs also notched a win of her own PERIOD

For the Panthers they hope this win sets a good tone for the team going into a twomatch weekend against Jacksonville State and Tennessee State both Ohio Valley Conference opponents PERIOD

It feels really good Whitley said PERIOD We have two matches this weekend we feel like were coming off of a good win it helps us boost our confidence it was our first home match so it feels really good going into this weekend knowing we have a win under our belt already. with the win the Panthers improve to  overall PERIOD The team will open up conference play at home again this weekend against Jacksonville State on Saturday and Tennessee State on Sunday PERIOD Both matches will take place at Darling Courts with the match against Jacksonville State starting at  a.m. and the Tennessee State match starting at  a.m PERIOD
